description: From Middle English misbehaven, equivalent to mis- +â€Ž behave.

verbs.description: misbehave (third-person singular simple present misbehaves, present participle misbehaving, simple past and past participle misbehaved)

entries.meaning: (intransitive or reflexive) To act or behave in an inappropriate, improper, incorrect, or unexpected manner.
examples: He doesn't mean to misbehave; he just doesn't know better.
